name: Grand Hyatt Washington

reviews.title: Good Hotel, Excellent Location
reviews.text: I always try to give a very objective rating and I'll be absolutely fair on this one. Very impressive atrium and the service is friendly. Attended to by a very charming Jamaican lady at reception. Friendly concierge as well. A big plus is that the metro is linked to the hotel. We did not eat at the hotel so I cannot comment on the food. I must agree with other reviewers on the "okay-but-not-a-wonderful" bed but I should not complain because I got an excellent internet rate. Rooms are exceptionally clean and I particularly liked the rooms overlooking the atrium. When I returned after a day's stay at the Reston Hyatt (great beds) for a further two days at the Grand Hyatt in DC we were not given a room overlooking the atrium and it was "gloomier" but we were out for most of the day and too tired to care when we returned. Safe to walk at night: Chinatown, movies and a very short cab ride to Union Station. Pleasant walk to the White House. Close to pharmacy and Starbucks.

reviews.title: Unbeatable Value
reviews.text: Stayed here on a $80/night PL bid 2/16-2/19. Was given a room on the "Gold Passport" level as I am a GP member. Great hotel - convenient to the Metro station (just an escalator ride from the lobby). Would stay here again on a PL bid, but wouldn't pay the normal $250+ per night.

reviews.title: The Perfect Place To Stay!
reviews.text: We thouroughly enjoyed our stay at the Grand Hyatt. The location and accomotations are perfect. We utilized the Metro on several occasions which is just underneath the hotel. I would definately recommend getting yourself a color coded Metro map or bringing a red, blue, orange & green highliter. The Metro was confusing the first day but got easier as we learned the ropes. We also took the Trolley one day which enabled us to cover a lot of ground in easy fashion. It stops in front of the Hyatt. We walked to the Spy Museum, the Ford Theatre, the Mint and the Mall, all a fifteen minute max walk.

reviews.title: A classy place
reviews.text: The hotel has a great deli, the Zephr, very reasonable, fresh, quick food. The breakfast buffet at the hotel was good but expensive. The Grand Slam restaurant in the hotel was dark, smoky but had decent food. We went to Capital City Brewing Co, Oceanaire(expensive) and the Hard Rock Cafe, all within a 5-10 minute walk from the hotel and the food and service were excellent at all three places.

reviews.title: Good, but not great
reviews.text: The rooms were very nice, fresh and clean. We had a king bed which was plush, the kids had the two doubles which were not quite as nice. They got their room at half price.

reviews.title: Great Hotel. Great Location
reviews.text: The Zoo was fantastic as was the Spy Museum, the Mint, the National Cemetary, the Memorials and all the Smithsonian museums. The kids had a great time ice skating at the mall.

reviews.title: Great location, otherwise...
reviews.text: Above average only for the location, which was fabulous. Accessible directly from the Metro Center station (though through another building's lobby - head toward the 11th Street exit from the trains), which is on the Red Line for the Zoo and Dupont Circle, the Blue Line for Arlington Cemetery and National Airport, the Orange Line for other areas in Arlington. Blocks from the MCI Center, near Ford's Theater, a not-ridiculous walk from the Mall (the Blue and Orange lines also go to the Smithsonian Metro station), lots of good restaurants within blocks, etc.

Checked my bag before check-in and after check-out. The service was efficient and friendly, as it was at the front desk. Room was clean, and had lots of pillows. The vanity area in the bathroom was attractive (granite countertop, dark cherry-colored molding around mirror, nice sconces), and had a two-shelf unit, which was very convenient.
reviews.title: Great location, Very Happy with Stay
Nice hotel, but not extraordinary
reviews.text: Unfortunately, the rest of room was underwhelming. Both double beds were way too soft (the mattresses even wiggled sideways), terrible water pressure in the tub (slightly better in the shower, but not much), and a TV having occasional issues. The lighting was too dim both at the sink (for makeup) and in the shower (for, well, seeing).

reviews.title: Great location
reviews.text: Nothing bad enough to complain about - I was too worn out to move to another room anyway - but in no way, shape, or form worth the hotel's "regular" $300+ rate. I got it for $140 on Hotwire, not terrible for a midweek stay while the cherry trees were in bloom, and a lot better than I could find elsewhere.

I think the king rooms with Hyatt's special beds may be fine (I wasn't willing to take a smoking room to get one). The double rooms, though, should be avoided until the Grand Hyatt decides to make those guests equally (or at least adequately) comfortable.
reviews.title: Good value overall
Loved the Grand Hyatt
reviews.text: I live in DC but stayed here for one night to escape my housemates when my boyfriend was in town, and everything was impeccable. Both the service and room were excellent. We stayed at the club level which was definitely worth it, there's a cozy little lounge with refreshments, and our floor was very quiet. The room was on the small size but was comfortable for two people and was wonderfully decorated, the desk had an aeron chair and the bed was very comfortable. The bathroom was also very tastefully done and everything was clean and bright. Definitely recommended!

Yes the location is great and Metro Center is probably one of the most convenient locations on the entire Metro. When we arrived after an exhasting day of flying, I was disappointed to find the UP escalator from the Metro to the hotel to be out of order. The only other option was to exit onto the street and drag our suitcases around with us. However, we chose to drag them one by one, kerplunk kerplunk up the brolen escalator.
reviews.title: Good Hotel - but has a few problems

reviews.text: Checkin was rather chaotic and the checkin clerk took 3 phone calls while I was standing in front of him attempting to checkin. We payed extra for the Concierge Floor with snacks and drinks. When we finally made it to our room and visited the free Lounge, I was told that mixed drinks were extra and that I could have tea or water free or charge. I paid 75$ extra for tea and water??? I don't think so. The lady at the counter didn't bother to tell me that softdrinks were free, and I would not have known but another customer came to the counter while I was there and requested a coke. There were supposed to be snack foods there also...all that I was shown was a plate full of cookies. I think I will not be paying to upgrade next time...heck the Embassy Suites at Chevy Chase Pavilion gives you all of this in addition to mixed drinks and there is also a metro in the basement there.
reviews.title: This is one of Washington's best!

reviews.text: Went out to dinner instead of eating the meager snacks offered by this "illustrious" hotel. When we came back and went to bed, the people in the adjoining room to us (yes this podunk 5 star hotel still has adjoining rooms) had decided to have a party with what sounded like 20 or 30 people in their room. The roar of the crowd was unbelievable. I called the front desk 3 times to complain. Every time the response was the same " No Problem Mr. Doe". Well obviously it was a problem because nothing was ever done. Finally at 11:45 pm on my 3rd call I told them they were either going to fix the problem or find me a new hotel! After that security was called to the room and the party adjourned.
reviews.title: Very pleased

reviews.text: The next morning's breakfast in the private lounge was good, but still not worth the cost to upgrade.
reviews.title: Great place

aka: Grand Hyatt Washington Hotel Washington Dc
description: Centrally located in trendy Penn Quarter – with convenient in-lobby Metro Center access – this downtown Washington DC hotel is an ideal spot to explore the US capital. Enjoy stylish guestrooms with plush Grand Beds™, indulgent amenities and multiple dining venues. Utilize our full-service business center and 32 outstanding meeting rooms – just steps from Washington Convention Center. Relax by the lagoon in our lovely 12-story atrium. Escape to extraordinary elegance at Grand Hyatt Washington.
